intro: Ptilotus semilanatus, commonly known as the sandhill flax-lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, triangular stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
